context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and approve orders within the order management system.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
business: Maintain efficient order processing to enhance customer satisfaction.
description: Authorize managers to review and approve orders to progress business workflows.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Selected orders are approved and processed.
Order status is updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display orders pending approval.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
The system shall update order status upon approval.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for order approval.
main_flow: 1. Manager selects an order to approve → System displays order details.
2. Manager reviews the order details → System allows manager to approve or reject the order.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status to approved.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): If the manager decides to reject the order, then the system allows the manager to provide a reason for rejection and updates the order status to rejected.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the order details are incomplete, then the system prompts the manager to review the missing information.
